root.name: Skins Game
root.description: OverviewReleased in 2000, Skins Game was a golf simulator which allowed players to play up to 18 holes of golf on three different courses. The game had four different game modes: Tournament mode, which utilized the Midway Tournament Network allowing for competitive online play (while the service was still maintained.) Competitive mode, which was a standard game of golf with control over the back and forward spin. Extreme mode, which added air control to competitive mode. Hole-in-One contest.All of the game modes featured power-ups such as "power shots", mulligans and exploding golf balls. Controls Shot of the controls The cabinet incorporated a spring-loaded stick to help mimic the swinging of a golf club, in addition to a number pad that was used to add features during tournament play.
